user-story.i-want: upcoming videos to preload and stay responsive
user-story.so-that: playback never stutters even when I swipe quickly.

acceptance-criteria.criterion: Video preloader warms the previous and next two videos using controller pooling and releases resources when out of range. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-4.md#implementation-guide]
Local cache keeps up to 100 MB of feed data (Hive box `feed_cache`) with LRU eviction and redis hydration on launch. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-4.md#source-tree--file-directives]

Background worker `feed_prefetch_worker.ts` pre-warms CloudFront cache hourly for trending feed segments, configurable via `FEED_PREFETCH_CRON_EXPRESSION`. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-4.md#source-tree--file-directives]
**PERFORMANCE CRITICAL**: Video startup latency ≤ 800 ms P95 after preload; cold loads ≤ 2 s P95. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-4.md#performance-metrics]
Cache health metrics (hit rate, eviction count, preload queue depth) are emitted to Datadog and exposed via debug overlay. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-4.md#analytics--observability]

task.description: Implement `preload_videos_use_case.dart` controlling warm-up and teardown of queued controllers.
Update `video_feed_item.dart` to request preloaded controllers and expose preload debug overlay toggled via long-press.
Add `feed_performance_service.dart` to capture preload metrics and surface to overlay.
Create `feed_prefetch_worker.ts` (serverless) to pull trending videos from Serverpod and issue CloudFront cache warm requests.
Provision Terraform `feed_cdn.tf` + `feed_redis.tf` resources and ensure IAM roles permit signed cookie generation.
Implement `feed_cache_manager.dart` for Redis hydration and TTL enforcement.
Add Segment event `feed_preload_complete` with latency metadata.
